content.description: The route was originally graded as V7 but I suspect it was because the crack was not used for jams. Crack gloves are a must if you don't want to do the V7. The start is the same as the V6 but instead of going right you go left into the crack. There are 2 left-hand jams, one right-hand jam, and one left foot jam.
content.location: Left of the V6 but same start.

content.description: Do you have a one-dimensional way of looking at life? Do the second and third dimensions just make your stomach turn? Then this might be the boulder for you. Mini jugs on a 45° wall with few feet. Just straight forward board style moves. And there ain't nothing wrong with that. If the rock was better, this thing would get more stars.Sit start with the obvious tooth shaped jug.  Maintain tension as you surf right on the edge rail. Snag the left hand jug at the top and then rock on over using choss jugs.
content.location: See the description for the Terries Boulder

content.description: Steep board style boulder up the hill from the Arena/Foo. Being almost at the cliff ridge, affords great views of the Sibling and Tiger Style boulders. Faces south east.  Gets sun early.  Not the best rock for the area but certainly not the worst.
